description: good text editor for c++ and for competitive progrmaing

its perfect.

description: every time I reinstall my OS, I always install a version of this program even in windows.
This is the fastest IDE I have ever used. Highly recommended.
I use this all the time for writing C, very good ide while following the head first guide. I love the fact you don't need to create a project, just create a new file and build it.
It is  much powerful to use. like a complete (huge) IDE. It reminds me on Notepad++ in many cases.
My favorite lightweight editor for writing C/C++ code.
This is the best lightweight IDE I have ever used for Python and C/C++ development. It is available in almost every Linux distribution repositories and is easy to use.

Geany is one of those pieces of software that offers everything I need and nothing I don't use. If you're working on multiple text files at a time -- whether they're code or just plain text -- I strongly recommend geany. Excellent options for searching between files, saving all files at once, syntax highlight, joining lines, etc.
summary: Amazing balance of lightweight and powerful

description: Geany is my favourite text editor. It's a great alternative of Sublime Text or Atom.
summary: Fast, lightweight, and full of features

description: This program is amazing for me! I like it! Thanks!

Geany is great for a lot of scripting languages. If you use a compiled language then you should get an IDE. Also great for markup (especially html)! Love this program and will continue to use in the future!
Just do't waste your time....Install it...
Lightweight and stable ide for lots of programming languages
kubuntu 18.04 , Color sheme only white background. Even if your theme is dark. This is fail. My eyes will bleeding if i will use this fail

I've been using gedit to write C code for years. If you accidentally delete 10 lines of code, too bad you're stuck (no undo). I had tried other IDE solutions, but always found them too overwhelming. I recently discovered and started using Geany. Wow! I love this. It's perfect for me. It doesn't force me into some unfamiliar working paradigm. Very easy to understand and very easy to set preferences to make it work just the way you want. I can't recommend it highly enough.
summary: Wished I had discovered Geany years ago

description: Lightweight but powerful. Is my default replacement for gedit.
Basic java can be done....

A true gem of an application. Column/block selection, VCS integration, uncomplicated builder integration, symbols list, document list, tags, many search options, fast to open, works great on all the major operating systems.
summary: The best text editor and a great IDE

description: Suitable for languages like c and c++.
Supports key languages like C,C++,Java,Python and other web development languages. All in One IDE

Gedit seems to have atrophied, and with Geany now on GTK3, it's my go-to. Not as heavy as GNOME Builder, but more configurable than Gedit.

For those complaining about lack of theming, yeah there's no geany-themes package in Ubuntu. It's frustrating, but not insurmountable. I just scp-ed my geany themes over from a Fedora instance on my LAN. You can also find geany themes on Github. Just Google, download and put them in your ~/.config/geany/colorschemes directory.
summary: Simple enough yet powerful and themable

description: Its pretty good, and its leightweightness makes it my primary editor since others (*cough*android studio*cough*) take some time to load up, whereas i can start immediately when using geany.
A great simple, multipurpose app, never had a problem with it. It's my go to app to install in a new distro.

I've got an error 'Failed to open file '/usr/share/geany/geany.glade': No such file or directory' with geany. Removing it and installing Geany worked. (Notice: There are 2 packages using the same name).

Your conversion from WIndows/notepad++ to Linux is not complete until you begin using 'The genie'.

I spent a week trying to make notepadqq work nicely on linux - including compiling it directly to avoid the 'no permission' problems encountered after the 'snap' install. But even then it was unacceptably slow.

Be sure to also install the plugins [ sudo apt-get install geany-plugins] and activate 'Addons' to complete the full notepad++ functions.
summary: Show me a better general purpose editor!

From 0 to hello world in less than 30 seconds. I tried a bunch of other FOSS Linux C++ IDEs and most of them were either unstable, required build wizardry, or were trying to upsell you/spy on you/ whatever gooby crud microsoft does.

So far this seems to be better than just writing code in nano and calling g== myself, so that's cool.
I had gEdit then I found this. I can open files from the app! if FireFox is open I can run a file from the app! Whoever made the app knows what he or she is doing.

I just could not get used to Gedit with its new GUI. I tried for years, thinking it was just me. Today I decided I'm simply done with Gedit. Geany gives me everything I'm looking for without any fuss. Love it.

I work on complex C projects (AI & Cognitive Computing). I have to write standard C code so that all is portable. Since many years I'm using code::blocks but Geany is far more simple and the integration with the GNOME desktop is excellent ;-)

I've had a hard time finding a decent non-Vim non-Emac IDE for the Nvidia NX while I've been developing on it. Unfortunately, pickings are slim, but Geany is a decent IDE for developing C/C++ as long as you can make a Makefile to suit your needs.

The only problem is, right now, I could really use a debugger and the debugger plugin is not supported for Ubuntu at 18.04 and above. This is a sad discovery for me. So I'll have to try else where for a C/C++ editor.

But all things considered, Geany is great! Especially for writing high level code like python, javascript etc. Pretty much every common programming language is supported, including modern languages like Go and Rust.
summary: Great IDE for Nvidia Jetson NX. Wish the debugger was still supported

description:
That's a very good and light IDE, that can be used from scripting to advanced compiler and for text editing too.
It is not powerful as Eclipse or some commercials or specific IDE for heavy projects, but, those are often too complex for most projects. And Geany does not spread yours datas everywhere!

Some points to improve:
- Vim mode can be seriously improved
- LSP support...
- code navigation (TOC for markdown/reStructuredText, functions for scripting languages)
- preview markdown|html|etc in separate window
- maybe an integrated support for code documentation (sphinx, full markdown (mermaid?), doxygen. etc )
I used this for my project which involved writing c code. I haven't tried any alternatives, but this worked well enough.
It's just 3.5 Megabyte in Ubuntu Repository. Flatpack and snap both sucks.
...is very efficient ! A great text editor that's quick to get used to. Whether you're an amateur programmer or just want a fast, simple editor that's powerful enough, Geany is the way.

Si escribes código en cualquier lenguaje, esta es una excelente herramienta. He probado SCITE, Sublime, Gedit, y este es el que más me ha gustado por porque reune las caracteristicas que me gustan en un solo editor. Por eso definitivamente lo recomiendo.
Totalmente recomendable, lo utilizo para editar los ficheros de las paginas web que creo, intuitivo, elegante, practico y ágil.
Un clásico que no pasa de moda. Siempre funcional!
Años que llevo utilizando esta excelente herramienta...

Lo utilizó en el trabajo y en casa para hacer pruebas rápidas con scripts en Python y Php y funciona de maravilla. También lo uso para tomar notas de manera rápida en varios documentos grandes y los mueve como nada. Es muy rápido y estable. Dentro de los IDE ligeros es de lo mejor.
Aunque básico es muy util y lo mejor que con el uso de etiquetas puede ser tu editor web.
Una aplicacion muy buena
Un programa bastante sencillo fácil de usar

Bien sûr, ce n'est pas Notepad++ mais il fait le job. Permet le tri, le remplacement dans tous les fichiers ouverts, comprend les expressions régulières, etc. Pour la plupart des cas, cela suffit, d'autant qu'on peut rajouter des actions (par exemple trier à l'envers avec sort -R). Un bon choix pour un éditeur par défaut, meilleur que Pluma, et bien plus léger et ergonomique que Kate.
summary: Très bon petit éditeur de texte

description: Гибкий в настройке. Очень легкий на старт. В отличие от Sublime и прочих Atom/MS VSC ресурсов жрет примерно нисколько. Есть куча дополнений и тем оформления.
Куча дополнений , под себя можно настроить практически что угодно.
Очень удобно пользоваться
пользую и на винде и в линуксе. еще и на флэшке с собой таскаю.

summary: Топ для линукса, особенно для Ubuntu

description: Супер. Пробовал несколько IDE, но только эта зашла и понравилась. Легкая и в тоже время настраиваемая. В ней есть все что нужно для комфортной работы. Достаточно почитать отзывы, и я думаю сразу станет понятно что эта IDE - то что вы ищете.
Можно прописывать свои команды на F5 F8 и F9, это открывает кучу возможностей для запуска и компиляции программ.
Лучшее приложение для Linux
Топовое приложение. Работает и запускается быстро. Проблем пока не заметил. Есть возможность создания и компиляции проектов и файлов, поддерживает темную тему. Очень удобно!
Можетт кто подскажет? В редакторе знак подчеркивания не отображаеться?
Пишу в ней на C++. На C# выдаёт ошибку хотя код написан без ошибок( компилировал с помощью .NET Sdk).
Всё в одном. Лучшее приложение в своём классе.
summary: Отлично. Можно обходиться без других текстовых редакторов
